meanings.definition: To flatten or crush something into a thin, flat shape.
meanings.sent1: She was pancaking the dough to make it thin for the pie crust.
meanings.sent2: The chef was pancaking the burger patty on the grill.
meanings.sent3: The kids were pancaking the playdough to create different shapes.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the books was pancaking the cardboard box.
meanings.sent5: The steamroller was pancaking the asphalt to make a smooth road surface.

meanings.definition: The act of collapsing or falling in a stack of layers.
meanings.sent1: The pancaking of the building floors was a result of poor construction.
meanings.sent2: The pancaking of the cards made it difficult to shuffle them.
meanings.sent3: The pancaking of the blankets on the bed made it cozy and warm.
meanings.sent4: The pancaking of the leaves in the pile made it easier to jump into.
meanings.sent5: The pancaking of the papers on the desk made it hard to find anything.

meanings.definition: The process of creating a pancake.
meanings.sent1: The pancaking in the kitchen filled the house with a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent2: The pancaking for breakfast was a family tradition on Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The pancaking of the batter on the griddle was a messy but fun activity.
meanings.sent4: The pancaking of the syrup on the pancake made it extra sweet.
meanings.sent5: The pancaking of the toppings on the pancake added a burst of flavor.
